title: Estimate gas when not provided in ethereum/send-transaction event
body:
### User Story

As a developer, I want to have proper gas estimation when not providing it.

### Description

Update `ethereum/send-transaction` so that gas is estimated if not provided.

*Type*: Feature

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 80.0 DAI (80.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7103/2011). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7103/2011). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $45,117.07 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. **Done** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 9 months, 1 week from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [krisc](https://gitcoin.co/profile/krisc) has been approved to start work.**

In the send-transaction function, check the params if amount of gas has been provided. If not, make a call to estimate-gas. I would like to ask the developers how exactly to include this estimated gas price into the transaction.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/7103/2011).
@jeluard ^  Does this approach @krisc has described sound reasonable?

@krisc You can provide the gas by just associating the value to the `:gas` key. Is that the question?
Also keep in mind `estimate-gas` is an async call and the result is retrieved via a callback.
@jeluard Yes, I think that all I needed to know. Just wanted to make sure.
@krisc you've been approved to start work.

@krisc Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

Best way to debug your changes in `status-react` is probably just to add extra log statements.

I may have tangled things up in callback hell, but I'll investigate more tomorrow.

```
(defn- execute-send-transaction [db {:keys [method params on-result] :as arguments}]
    (log/debug "inside execute-send-transaction!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!")
    (let [tx-object (assoc (select-keys arguments [:to :gas :gas-price :value :nonce])
                         :data (when (and method params) (abi-spec/encode method params)))
        transaction (if  (:gas tx-object)
                         (prepare-extension-transaction tx-object (:contacts/contacts db) on-result)
                         (ethereum/estimate-gas-web3 (:web3 db)
                                                     params
                                                     (fn[e r] (log/error "estimate gas callback. gas is " r)
                                                              (prepare-extension-transaction (assoc tx-object :gas r) (:contacts/contacts db) on-result))))]
      (models.wallet/open-modal-wallet-for-transaction db transaction tx-object)))
```

In the second case (with estimate-gas call) `transaction` won't reference a transaction as it is created in the async callback, not returned by `estimate-gas-web3`.
You would need to call `open-modal-wallet-for-transaction` in the callback too.

@jeluard Okay, this code logically makes more sense to me, but I was only able to test it once today because my computer keeps crashing when deploying to my device :/

```
(defn- execute-send-transaction [db {:keys [method params on-result] :as arguments}]
    (let [tx-object (assoc (select-keys arguments [:to :gas :gas-price :value :nonce])
                         :data (when (and method params) (abi-spec/encode method params)))]
        (if (:gas tx-object) ;; gas is provided
            (models.wallet/open-modal-wallet-for-transaction 
              db 
              (prepare-extension-transaction 
                tx-object
                (:contacts/contacts db)
                on-result)
              tx-object)
            (ethereum/estimate-gas-web3 ;; gas not provided so estimate gas
              (:web3 db)
              params
              (fn[e r] (log/debug "estimate gas callback. gas is " r)
                (models.wallet/open-modal-wallet-for-transaction
                  db
                  (prepare-extension-transaction
                    (assoc tx-object :gas (+ r (* r .1))) ; add estimated gas plus 10 percent margin
                    (:contacts/contacts db)
                    on-result)
                  tx-object))))))
```
